title: Video: 2 Delta Planes Collide On Tarmac At New York Airport
content: Two commercial planes of Delta Airlines collided while taxiing at New York's LaGuardia Airport on Wednesday, causing one plane's wing to detach.

title: 'Trump's Science Cuts Could Lead To Brain Drain': Nobel Prize Officials
content: Donald Trump's assault on science could threaten the United States' position as the world's leading research nation and have knock-on effects worldwide, Nobel Prize officials in Sweden told AFP.

title: Google Warns Of Hackers Claiming To Steal Data From Oracle Apps
content: Alphabet's Google said hackers are sending extortion emails to an unspecified number of executives, claiming to have stolen sensitive data from their Oracle business applications.

title: 'Lecture On Rights Deeply Ironic': India Debunks Pakistan's Propaganda At UN
content: India has slammed Pakistan's hypocrisy at the United Nations Human Rights Council (UNHRC), saying it is "deeply ironic" that a nation with a record of minority persecution can lecture others on human rights.

title: Looming Health Care Costs At Heart Of Shutdown As Millions Face Premium Hikes
content: The US government shut down Wednesday, with Democratic lawmakers insisting that any deal address their health care demands and Republicans saying those negotiations can happen after the government is funded.

title: Walmart To Drop Artificial Colours, 30 Food Additives From Store Brands By 2027
content: Walmart said Wednesday that it plans to remove synthetic food dyes and 30 other ingredients, including some preservatives, artificial sweeteners and fat substitutes, from its store brands sold in the United States by January 2027.

title: From Retail Sales To Job Reports, Government Shutdown Delays Key US Economic Data
content: The government shutdown that began Wednesday will deprive policymakers and investors of economic data vital to their decision-making at a time of unusual uncertainty about the direction of the US economy.

title: Those Who Remain In Gaza City Will Be Considered Terrorists, Warns Israel
content: Israel issued a final warning Wednesday for people to flee Gaza's main city, as Hamas weighed US President Donald Trump's plan to end nearly two years of war in the Palestinian territory.

title: Elon Musk Is Now Worth $500 Billion, Can Become A Trillionaire Soon
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has become the first person in history to achieve a net worth of nearly half a trillion dollars.

title: 400 kg Ganja, Hidden Under Coconuts, Busted Near Hyderabad's Ramoji Film City
content: Upon inspection, officers discovered the large haul of drugs cunningly concealed beneath a legitimate load of coconuts, a tactic often used by smugglers to evade detection.

title: Meet Ali Akbar, Last Newspaper Hawker Who Makes Paris Laugh With His Headlines
content: Ali Akbar knows everyone and everyone knows him. The last newspaper hawker in Paris zigzags each day from cafe to cafe, shouting humorous headlines in the heart of the French capital.

title: Amid Shutdown Standoff, JD Vance Defends Donald Trump's AI Videos Of Top Democrat As 'Joke'
content: US Vice President JD Vance on Wednesday described AI-manipulated videos that President Donald Trump posted on social media of House Democratic Leader Hakeem Jeffries as a joke, dismissing complaints from Democrats that the videos were racist.

title: Meta To Soon Use AI Chats To Personalise Content, Ads, Users Can't Opt Out
content: Meta Platforms said it would begin using people's interactions with its generative AI tools to personalize content and advertising across its apps such as Facebook and Instagram starting on December 16.

title: Israel Intercepts Gaza Aid Flotilla, Says Greta Thunberg Safe And Healthy
content: Israeli naval forces on Wednesday intercepted a flotilla carrying aid to Gaza, ending its latest bid to break an Israeli blockade of the war-battered Palestinian territory.

title: "Symbol Of Victory Of Good Over Evil": PM Modi Extends Vijayadashami Greetings
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday extended warm greetings to the nation on the auspicious occasion of Vijayadashami and prayed that people draw inspiration from the festival to move forward with courage and wisdom.

title: Trump To Meet Xi In 4 Weeks With Big Soybean Push After Tariff War
content: President Donald Trump signaled Wednesday that he plans to push Chinese leader Xi Jinping on US soybean purchases when they meet, as American farmers grapple with fallout from his trade wars.

title: PM Modi To Attend Dussehra Celebrations In East Delhi's Patparganj
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will participate in the Dussehra festivities organised by the IP Extension Ramlila Committee in the national capital on Thursday.

title: Trump Says He Will Meet Chinese President Xi Jinping In 4 Weeks
content: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said that he will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping in four weeks, with the soybean issue to be a significant topic of their discussion.

title: Canada Warns Citizens With 'X' Gender Passports Of US Entry Restrictions
content: The Canadian government issued a warning this week to citizens holding passports with the nonbinary "X" gender designation in their passports, saying they could face difficulties when trying to enter the United States.

title: President Murmu, PM Modi pay homage to Gandhi, Shastri on birth anniversary
content: President Murmu and PM Modi honor Gandhi and Shastri, emphasising their leadership and commitment to a self-reliant India

title: Bomb attack on BJP leader’s house in Kerala’s Cherukunnu
content: Preliminary suspicion is that a group of assailants arrived on a motorbike to carry out the attack. Explosive remnants were recovered from the veranda

title: Watch: What are RBI’s new steps to promote internationalisation of the Rupee?
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said banks are now permitted to lend in Indian Rupees to non-residents from Bhutan, Nepal, and Sri Lanka for bilateral trade transactions, encouraging global use of the INR.

title: Russian President Putin set to visit India in early December
content: Ahead of Mr. Putin's trip, Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov will travel to India next month to finalise the finer details of the presidential visit

title: Women's World Cup: No Handshake Policy for Women in Blue
content: It will also be closely watched as to who presents the toss in Colombo, with expectations that it would be a former player or pundit from a neutral nation.

title: Release of coin, stamp on RSS insult to Constitution: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) said the entire exercise is to "whitewash the shameful role of the RSS" which was not just distant from the freedom struggle but actually strengthened the British strategy of divide and rule.

title: Cough syrup linked to deaths of two children in Rajasthan; 22 batches of the drug banned
content: At least 8,200 bottles remain in stock at Jaipur's Sawai Man Singh Hospital, but authorities have instructed that they should not be given to patients.

title: Sonam Wangchuk’s wife writes to President Murmu for his release, seeks intervention on ‘witch-hunt’
content: Gitanjali Angmo, in her letter, asked if it was a sin to fight against reckless and unchecked development activities in an ecologically fragile area of Ladakh

title: CJI Gavai's mother Kamala Gavai says she won't attend RSS centenary  function in Maharashtra
content: “If I had been on the dais (at the October 5 RSS function), I would have put forward the Ambedkarite ideology,” Kamala Gavai wrote

title: Tejasvi Surya to head parliamentary panel on Jan Vishwas Bill, LS speaker reconstitutes committees
content: BJP leader Baijayant Panda was appointed chairman of the select committee to examine the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code Bill, while the chairpersons of almost all the department-related parliamentary panels, including Congress leader Shashi Tharoor, have been re-nominated to their respective positions

title: Ladakh L-G chairs security review meeting, says restrictions to be lifted in a phased manner
content: Kavinder Gupta lauded the relentless efforts of the security forces and the civil administration in restoring normalcy over the past week

title: Karur stampede | Government did its part, TVK failed in its duty: DMK’s Senthilbalaji
content: Pointing to a recent DMK “Mupperum Vizha” in Karur, which drew nearly 2.5 lakh people, Mr. Senthilbalaji contrasted the preparations

title: Touch of Telangana at Bathukamma, Dasara celebrations in Detroit
content: The festivities organised by the Global Telangana Association (GTA) Detroit Chapter witnessed a record-breaking attendance

title: ‘Congress is a party of factions and internal rifts’ says Haryana CM Saini
content: The cooperative societies had lost the trust of farmers during the Congress regime, but our government will work to restore this trust, says Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini

title: Cabinet approves ₹11,440 crore mission to make India self-sufficient in pulses
content: The "Mission for Aatmanirbharta in Pulses", approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, will be for the period from 2025-26 to 2030-31

title: India, EFTA trade pact comes into force: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
content: The Union Commerce Minister said the pact will unlock new opportunities for trade, investment and job creation, benefiting people and businesses

title: Any issue can be resolved only through talks: Ladakh L-G Kavinder Gupta to agitating groups
content: Mr. Gupta lashes out at Rahul Gandhi for his remarks on the Ladakh situation, alleging that the Congress leader was trying to “vitiate the atmosphere” in the country

title: Search operation launched after suspicious movement in J&K’s Kathua
content: The search operation was jointly launched by the police and the Border Security Force (BSF) in the area along the Ujh river near the Jhathana village located near the International Border

title: Watch: What happened on September 27, the night of the stampede in Karur? | Reporter’s Diary
content: What began as routine political rally by actor-turned politician Vijay’s TVK in Karur soon spiralled into chaos and at least 41 people died in a stampede. The Hindu’s C. Jaisankar was on the ground that fateful day. This is his first-hand account of how the tragedy unfolded.

title: Mortar shell defused along LoC in J&K’s Rajouri
content: The shell is believed to have landed in the village from across the border during cross-border shelling during Operation Sindoor in May

title: GST collections rise by 9% to ₹1.89 lakh crore in September
content: The GST collections were 9.1% higher than the same month a year ago and over 1.5% higher than the previous month

title: India welcome to collect Asia Cup trophy from me at ACC office in Dubai: Mohsin Naqvi
content: In a post on X, Mr. Naqvi rejected reports claiming that he, at the ACC AGM on Tuesday (September 30), apologised to BCCI officials for his actions at the presentation ceremony

title: Bareilly violence: 2 'outsiders' with criminal history nabbed after gunfight with police
content: District Magistrate Avinash Singh on Wednesday (October 1) said nearly 80 accused have been identified in the case, and arms licences of half a dozen people are being cancelled.

title: PM unveils ₹100 coin, stamp at RSS centenary; first-ever depiction of Bharat Mata on Indian currency
content: In the mission of building a developed India by 2047, the contribution of the Sangh will be crucial, said PM Modi.

title: Dowry cases rise by 14% in 2023; over 6,100 women killed: NCRB
content: Uttar Pradesh again topped the chart with 2,122 deaths, followed by Bihar with 1,143. Dowry was listed as the motive in 833 murder cases across the country in 2023

title: Civic notice to school for 'ban' on religious, cultural symbols
content: The controversy erupted after some parents raised objections over students being prohibited from wearing 'tilak' or 'tikli' (bindi) on their foreheads, bangles, and rakhi or sacred threads.

title: 150 years of national song ‘Vande Mataram’ to be celebrated across India: Union Cabinet
content: Briefing reporters on the decisions taken by the Union Cabinet, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that keeping in mind the role played by the song during the freedom struggle, a decision was taken to hold country-wide celebrations to mark its 150th year.

title: Rajesh Agrawal takes charge as Commerce Secretary
content: Rajesh Agrawal was the chief negotiator for the India-U.S. Bilateral Trade Agreement, Indo-Pacific Economic Forum, India-Australia CECA, and review of the ASEAN FTA

title: Cabinet hikes wheat MSP by ₹160 per quintal to ₹2,585
content: The MSP has been decided based on the recommendations of the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP), says Information and Broadcasting Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Congress did protest Rahul death threat, CPI(M) ministers 'mistaken': LoP Satheesan
content: Satheesan said that the threat by the BJP leader, Printu Mahadevan, was made on a news channel on September 26

title: Centre hikes Dearness Allowance/Dearness Relief by 3%; to benefit 1.18 crore employees, pensioners
content: The DA/DR increase of 3% over the existing rate of 55% of the basic pay/pension to compensate against the price rise is effective July 1, 2025

title: Former Punjab Minister Anil Joshi joins Congress
content: Anil Joshi’s joining came days after he met Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and party general secretary (organisation) K.C. Venugopal in Delhi

title: Ennore building collapse: PMK demands inquiry, seeks compensation for victims
content: The building, under construction at the Ennore Thermal Power Station in North Chennai, collapsed on September 30, claiming the lives of nine migrant workers, all hailing from Assam

title: TVK postpones Vijay’s Saturday rallies in the wake of Karur stampede
content: In a social media update, the party’s official handle pointed out to the Karur tragedy and said “we are in anguish and regret over the loss of 41 of our brethren”

title: No proposal to levy charges on UPI transactions: RBI Governor Malhotra
content: The Governor said the central bank is examining a proposal to allow lenders to remotely lock mobile phones bought on credit in case of default in EMI payments

title: Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj Party submits memorandum to Bihar Governor for Deputy CM's removal
content: A delegation of the fledgling party, headed by national president Uday Singh and State unit chief Manoj Bharti, visited Raj Bhavan late Tuesday evening

title: US govt shutdown: Why it happened and how much it’s costing per day – explained in 10 points
content: The US government faces a shutdown over a deadlock on Affordable Care Act funding, as Democrats insist on subsidies while Republicans oppose them. This impasse has furloughed 750,000 federal workers, closed national sites, and costs $400 million daily. Essential services, air travel, and the economy are severely impacted, with no resolution in sight.

title: Watch: Israel intercepts boat with Greta onboard; video shows vessels sprayed with water cannons
content: The Israeli navy intercepted a humanitarian flotilla en route to Gaza, detaining activists including Greta Thunberg. Israel claimed the vessels aimed for provocation, not aid, citing a lawful naval blockade. However, the Global Sumud Flotilla condemned the interception as illegal, alleging ramming and communication interference against their peaceful aid mission.

title: Two Delta planes collide while taxiing at LaGuardia Airport; wing of one plane detached
content: A low-speed collision between two Delta regional jets occurred Wednesday evening at LaGuardia Airport, injuring one person. The right wing of one aircraft struck the nose of another, causing significant damage, including a lost wing section and shattered windshields. One jet, Delta Flight 5047, was taxiing after landing from Charlotte when the incident happened.

title: Musk hits $500bn net worth: First ever to cross milestone; Tesla rebound leads surge
content: Elon Musk made history on October 1, becoming the first person to achieve a staggering $500.1 billion net worth. This monumental financial leap was primarily fueled by a strong rebound in Tesla shares and soaring valuations of his other ventures, including SpaceX and xAI.

title: Inflation to be lower than RBI projections; why SBI expects softer prices
content: The State Bank of India forecasts inflation for FY26 and FY27 to be significantly lower than the Reserve Bank of India's estimates, citing a strong monsoon, higher crop sowing, and GST rate rationalization. This comes as RBI already lowered its FY26 CPI forecast and maintained policy rates.

title: 'Forced closure': Trump's first reaction after US govt shutdown; claims billions can be saved
content: US President Donald Trump urged Republicans to leverage the ongoing federal government shutdown to eliminate waste and fraud, claiming billions in savings. The shutdown, which began Wednesday, has already closed iconic sites and furloughed 750,000 federal workers. With Democrats and Republicans trading blame, critical economic data is delayed, potentially complicating Federal Reserve decisions on interest rates amid inflation concerns.

title: Dussehra 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Dussehra, or Vijayadashami, is a vibrant Indian festival celebrating the triumph of good over evil, specifically Lord Rama's victory over Ravana. Observed on October 2, 2025, it features effigy burnings, fairs, and marks the end of Navratri. This festival promotes joy, new beginnings, and hope, reminding everyone that goodness always prevails.

title: Aishwarya, Abhishek Bachchan take YouTube to court; seek protection against AI videos
content: Bollywood stars Abhishek Bachchan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan sued YouTube over AI-generated deepfakes misusing their personas. They demand content removal and safeguards to prevent their likeness from training AI models without consent, citing concerns about misleading information. This landmark case in India seeks $450,000 in damages and a permanent injunction.

title: 'Implied escort work': Russian YouTuber alleges harassment at FRRO office; officials deny charge
content: Russian influencer Kristina Kumar alleged harassment by FRRO officials during her visa extension process in Delhi, claiming they asked intrusive personal questions, checked her phone, and implied she was an escort. Kumar has approached the Russian Embassy and FRRO head. However, FRRO officials deny the allegations, stating questions were part of an inquiry into document irregularities.

title: No Pak, no problem! Pycroft gets rousing welcome at toss - Watch
content: Match referee Andy Pycroft, previously embroiled in an Asia Cup handshake controversy, received a warm welcome at the India vs West Indies 1st Test. Shubman Gill, making his home debut as India's Test captain, saw West Indies win the toss and bat first. The match began smoothly, free from any past drama.

title: ‘Not our projects’: Infra push without consent fuels Ladakh unrest; exclusion fears deepen anger
content: The catalogue of projects is long and accelerating. The 255km Darbuk–Shyok–Daulat Beg Oldi road links Leh to India’s northernmost airstrip. The 14.2km Zojila tunnel, under construction between Sonamarg and Drass, is expected to slash travel time to 20 minutes in winter.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
content: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: Shubman Gill’s captaincy debut at home targets WTC boost against depleted Windies
content: India faces immense pressure in the upcoming home Test against a depleted West Indies, led by Shubman Gill. Crucial WTC points are at stake, with India aiming to correct past mistakes. A grassy red-soil pitch at Ahmedabad suggests a balanced attack of pace and spin, leveraging India's all-rounders and potentially four spinners.

title: NYPD officer poses as Trump's bodyguard: Busted after suspicious behavior
content: An NYPD detective faced suspension after a bizarre incident at the Ryder Cup. He allegedly disguised himself as Donald Trump's security. The officer, Melvin Eng, was on sick leave. He bypassed security layers at Bethpage Black. His deception unraveled when he dropped a gun magazine. This raised serious security concerns. Eng now faces administrative charges.

title: US government shutdown: The impact on America’s workforce - explained in numbers
content: The US federal government shut down after President Trump and Congress failed to agree on a spending bill, leaving hundreds of thousands of federal workers furloughed without pay. Essential personnel, including military and air traffic controllers, will continue working unpaid, as deep partisan divides in the Senate prevented any funding agreement from passing.

title: ‘Classic case of blind faith’: HC jails man for killing wife; nixes his 1984 acquittal
content: After a 43-year legal battle, the Allahabad High Court convicted an elderly man and an accomplice for strangling his wife in 1982. Overturning a 1984 acquittal, Awadhesh Kumar and Mata Prasad received life imprisonment for murder, masked as a ghost exorcism. The court condemned this shocking case of blind faith, also imposing fines and three-year sentences for destroying evidence.

title: Sangh centenary: PM underlines RSS fight against caste bias; flags illegal immigration
content: PM Modi lauded the RSS's continuous fight against caste discrimination and untouchability, citing its chiefs' calls for shared public spaces. He defended the Sangh against 'Brahmanical outfit' claims and highlighted its historical involvement in the freedom struggle and post-independence movements. Modi also reiterated his strong warning about illegal immigration posing a significant threat to India's demography and internal security.

title: RBI expands credit for companies; limits on loans against shares hiked 5x
content: The Reserve Bank of India introduced major reforms, allowing banks to finance mergers, acquisitions, and IPOs more freely. It raised limits on loans against shares and debt securities, easing borrowing rules for large companies. These changes, effective October 2025, aim to expand credit access, improve liquidity, and deepen capital market participation, complementing government reforms.

title: 'Tariffs to help farmers': Trump announces meet with China's Xi; US soybeans in focus
content: Donald Trump announced plans to use tariff revenue to aid American soybean farmers, who are suffering because China has halted purchases for "negotiating" reasons. He criticized Joe Biden for not enforcing a trade agreement and vowed to address the issue with Xi Jinping, as China now buys from Brazil and Argentina.

title: Bigg Boss 19's Awez Darbar reacts to rumours of paying Rs 2 crore penalty
content: Evicted Bigg Boss 19 contestant Awez Darbar refuted claims of paying a Rs 2 crore penalty to exit, stating he genuinely loves reality shows and wouldn't leave voluntarily. He expressed disappointment over his eviction, questioning the makers' timing and his vote count despite trending high. Darbar also shared how the show toughened his personality.

title: Asia Cup debacle: Afridi warns PCB chief Naqvi - 'It would be a big decision'
content: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi advised Mohsin Naqvi to relinquish either his PCB chairmanship or Interior Ministry role, stressing Pakistan cricket's critical need for undivided focus. Afridi noted Naqvi's multiple high-profile positions, which he believes hinder dedicated attention to the sport, especially following the team's poor showings in the 2025 Champions Trophy and Asia Cup.

title: Post of the year: Antonio Brown’s savage Tyreek Hill meme post surgery goes viral
content: Antonio Brown sparked outrage by mocking Tyreek Hill with a viral meme just hours after Hill's season-ending surgery. Brown's controversial post, featuring pregnant hospital staff, targeted Hill's recovery and personal life, leading to a polarized social media reaction of laughter and sharp criticism. This incident added salt to Hill's already painful recovery.

title: Asia Cup | 'India are No. 1, but their actions are third-rate': Ex-Pak cricketer
content: India boycotted the Asia Cup 2025 trophy presentation, refusing to accept it from PCB Chairman Mohsin Naqvi. Naqvi reportedly departed with the trophy, leaving India to celebrate without it. Former Pakistani cricketer Basit Ali criticized India's "third-rate" actions, supporting Naqvi. India's captain emphasized their championship status mattered more than the physical trophy, adding new tension to India-Pakistan cricket relations.

title: UCL: Haaland keeps scoring; Messi's record in danger
content: Erling Haaland set a new Champions League record. He reached 50 goals in 49 games, surpassing Ruud van Nistelrooy. Haaland now has 52 goals in 50 appearances. He is approaching Lionel Messi's 60-goal milestone. Haaland scored two goals against Monaco. Manchester City drew the match 2-2. He expressed disappointment after the game.

title: Popular freeze-dried chocolate snacks recalled as they may cause ‘traumatic injury’
content: A popular brand of chocolate-covered fruit snack products sold nationwide in the United States have been recalled due to potential metal contamination. It could cause traumatic injury. "Hard or sharp foreign objects in food may cause traumatic injury including laceration and perforation of tissues of the mouth, tongue, throat, stomach and intestine as well as damage to the teeth and gums," the FDA cautioned. Consumers are advised to discard affected items, identifiable by manufacturing codes on the packaging, and can seek a refund. No injuries have been reported as of September 26.

title: US shutdown: Will it mess with travel plans? Travellers should spare extra time
content: The US government shutdown has begun, creating uncertainty for immigration processes. While USCIS and most Department of State visa/passport services remain operational, the Department of Labor's Office of Foreign Labor Certification has ceased all functions. This halt prevents the filing of crucial LCAs and PERM applications, significantly delaying H-1B and green card processes until the shutdown concludes.

title: Assam: Govt okays widening of section of NH-715 to 4 lanes; to cost Rs 6.9K cr
content: The Cabinet approved a Rs 6,957 crore project to widen and improve the 86-km Kalibor-Numaligarh section of NH-715 in Assam, including 34.5 km of elevated sections through Kaziranga National Park. This initiative aims to eliminate human-animal conflict by abandoning the existing highway, allowing unhindered animal movement and boosting tourism while ensuring wildlife safety.

title: Fight with Kohli? Dhawan breaks silence: 'I abused a lot'
content: Shikhar Dhawan recently disclosed past conflicts with Virat Kohli, including a shoulder-tackling incident during warm-ups and a heated run-out that coincided with Dhawan's IPL auction disappointment. He also reflected on Kohli's early focus and increased seriousness after his father's passing. These revelations highlight their competitive dynamic and enduring professional relationship.

title: Klay Thompson stays silent on Megan Thee Stallion, eyes Mavericks goal
content: Dallas Mavericks' Klay Thompson targets a historic 50/40/90 shooting season, an elite benchmark, after deflecting personal questions at media day. His ambitious individual goal, combined with Kyrie Irving's crucial return from a torn ACL, is pivotal for the Mavericks' playoff aspirations in a highly competitive Western Conference. The team's success hinges on these key performances.

title: 'Kantara Chapter 1': Rishab Shetty called master storyteller on X; climax awestruck
content: Fans have taken to Twitter in droves to laud Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara Chapter 1,' declaring its climax not just unforgettable but a stirring emotional experience. This film, described by many as a testament to 'pure cinema,' invites viewers on a deeply resonant journey.

title: Wedding bells! Abhishek, mentor Yuvraj set the floor on fire - Watch
content: Indian cricketer Abhishek Sharma showcased his dancing skills alongside Yuvraj Singh and singer Ranjit Bawa at his sister Komal's pre-wedding function in Ludhiana. This celebration follows Sharma's recent triumph as Player of the Tournament in the Asia Cup 2025, where he scored 314 runs, including three consecutive half-centuries, and received a car for his exceptional performance.

title: Zubeen death: Fest organiser, manager held; sent to 14-day custody
content: Two prime accused in the Zubeen Garg death probe, Shyamkanu Mahanta and Siddharth Sharma, were arrested in Delhi and remanded to 14-day police custody in Guwahati. Charged with culpable homicide and negligence, their apprehension followed Interpol notices. Garg's widow expressed relief, hoping for answers regarding his final moments in Singapore, as public demand for justice intensifies.

title: RSS@100: CJI’s mom to skip Sangh function; flags remarks against husband
content: CJI Bhushan Gavai's mother, Kamaltai Gavai, confirmed she will not attend the Sangh's centenary event on October 5, citing health issues. Amid social media buzz regarding her supposed acceptance, Gavai clarified her steadfast dedication to Ambedkarite ideology. She highlighted her late husband's practice of attending such events to advocate Ambedkar's views, while never embracing Hindutva.

title: Putin likely to visit India: First visit since Ukraine war; ties review expected
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is anticipated to visit India in early December for the 23rd annual summit, marking his first trip since the Ukraine conflict began. Diplomatic sources suggest December 5-6 for the crucial meeting. This visit aims to review bilateral ties in trade, energy, and defence manufacturing, as India navigates its energy relationship with Moscow.

title: Malegaon case: 19 years on, charges framed against 4; hearing on Oct 29
content: A special court framed charges against four accused in the 2006 Malegaon blasts case. Lokesh Sharma, Dhan Singh, Rajendra Chaudhary, and Manohar Narwaria pleaded not guilty to murder and terror charges. Earlier, nine Muslim men were discharged after being proved innocent. The NIA took over the investigation and arrested the current accused. The trial will begin on October 29.

title: Sangh @100: RSS custodian of India’s civilisational philosophy, says Hosabale
content: RSS leaders celebrated the government's release of a commemorative stamp and coin, marking the Sangh's century-long journey and its recognition as a mainstream force. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh highlighted RSS's role in communal harmony, citing its assistance during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots and its respectful relationship with Mahatma Gandhi despite differences.

title: Punjab: 5 die of drug overdose in 3 days; state tops NCRB list
content: A drug overdose crisis has gripped Ferozepur, where four young men died within two days, pushing Punjab's weekly toll to five. The state led India in drug fatalities last year. Grieving families and furious villagers blocked a highway, alleging police inaction and doorstep drug delivery, intensifying calls for urgent government intervention against the rampant addiction.

title: Bareilly clashes: 2 Congress netas under house arrest; situation tense
content: Congress leaders Imran Masood and Kunwar Danish Ali faced house arrest. They intended to visit Bareilly after recent clashes. Police prevented their travel citing law and order concerns. Authorities made several arrests in Bareilly. Two men were nabbed after an encounter. Police recovered an anti-riot gun and pistols. A total of 81 arrests have occurred.

title: UP: IIT-K student found dead in hostel; absence noticed after foul smell
content: A 22-year-old IIT-Kanpur electrical engineering student, Dheeraj Saini, was found dead in his hostel room on Wednesday after not being seen since Sunday. Police, alerted by a foul smell, suspect depression as the cause, though no suicide note was found. Authorities are investigating, seizing his personal items, while his family stated they were unaware of any problems.

title: Rajasthan: Drug blamed for 2021 Delhi deaths claims life of 5-year-old; probe sought
content: Rajasthan faces scrutiny after a five-year-old died in Sikar from a dextromethorphan-based cough syrup, a drug linked to 2021 Delhi deaths. Despite Delhi's ban for young children, Rajasthan prescribed it under a free scheme. Officials are probing, but activists demand an independent inquiry into the widely distributed medicine, raising serious questions about public health oversight.

title: UP: 6 dead as ‘mentally unstable’ farmer kills 2 boys; sets self, family on fire
content: A chilling incident in Bahraich left six charred bodies, including two children, discovered in a house. Farmer Vijay Maurya allegedly murdered two village boys before setting his wife, two young daughters, and himself ablaze inside their home. Police suspect mental instability, citing an infant son's recent death and family disputes.

title: Police detain Congress MP, SP MLA at house to prevent from visiting Bareilly
content: The two leaders were scheduled to travel to the city by an early morning train to meet some police officers, but were confined to their residences

title: Arunachal Pradesh Congress demands apology from BJP over 'death threat' to Rahul Gandhi
content: "This is not just an irresponsible remark, but a criminal act of intimidation," APCC president Bosiram Siram said

title: How to attract birds, butterflies and other beings? - Experts suggest measures as HYDRAA rejuvenates Hyderabad’s lakes
content: People working towards documenting and restoration of biodiversity, urged authorities undertaking lake rejuvenation to take proactive measures to restore biodiversity

title: India wasted opportunity to give befitting reply to Pakistan after Pahalgam terror attack: Owaisi
content: Asaduddin Owaisi says an atmosphere of war had prevailed as drones launched by Pakistan hovered over the western borders from Gujarat to Kashmir

title: PM Modi's silence on atrocities in Gaza 'total betrayal' of what India has stood for: Congress
content: "Where is the accountability for the genocide that has been carried out in Gaza over the past twenty months?" Jairam Ramesh said

title: Odisha districts on alert as IMD forecasts heavy rain till October 5 owing to low pressure over Bay of Bengal
content: For October 2, it has issued a ‘Red’ warning of above 20-cm rainfall in Puri and Jagstingpur districts, an ‘Orange’ warning (7 cm to 20 cm rain) for 14 districts, and a ‘Yellow’ warning (7 cm to 11 cm rain) for the remaining 14 districts

title: Contractor booked in building collapse incident at Ennore SEZ thermal power project
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Chief Minister M.K. Stalin expressed grief over the incident; the nine victims hail from Assam

title: Major General G. Srinivas, who oversaw logistics in Operation Sindoor, takes charge as CDM Commandant
content: Before his appointment, Major General Srinivas was entrusted with the planning and execution of operational logistics in the Western Command theatre, including during the recent Operation Sindoor

title: Mid-air scuffle with Uttar Pradesh MLA lands passenger in police custody
content: The incident happened on Air India flight when MLA Rakesh Pratap Singh objected to a passenger, Samad Ali, allegedly using foul language while talking on the phone

title: Police close probe into stone attack on Anil Deshmukh; leader alleges pressure
content: The former Maharashtra Home Minister claimed the police were under pressure and the incident was being given a political colour

title: Zubeen Garg’s manager, Singapore festival organiser arrested from NCR, remanded to 14 days’ police custody
content: The two were flown to Guwahati and taken to the residence of the chief judicial magistrate concerned, as the courts are closed due to the Durga Puja holiday

title: Conflict-hit Manipur logged over 6,200 arson cases in 2023, 45% of India’s total
content: The sharp rise in arson cases in 2023 aligns with the widespread destruction recorded during the ethnic conflict that year in the State

title: Charge sheet filed against rapper Vedan and others for ‘ganja’ consumption
content: The accused have been charged under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act and they were let off on bail after their arrest

title: RSS general secretary hails “unwavering” public support for the Sangh through its 100-year journey
content: The Sangh consistently sought consensus on matters of Hindu unity, national security, social harmony, democracy, and preservation of culture, says Mr. Hosabale, adding that acceptance grew steadily over time

title: Speculating on ‘Kathipara’
content: ‘The entire area has a lot of streets that have Army connotations — Lashkarkhana (a camp), Asarghana (Afsar Khana or Officer’s Enclave), Butt Road (there was a rifle practice butt here), Magazine Road, North Parade, etc.’

title: When 50 people died in two Sunday stampedes in Chennai
content: The deaths of 50 people in two stampedes, both of which occurred on Sundays, in Chennai, 20 years ago, would illustrate how lessons in crowd management are rarely learned

title: Two police constables arrested for raping young woman in Tiruvannamalai
content: The 19-year-old survivor, who hails from Andhra Pradesh, was picked up by the duo after stopping the truck she was travelling in for checking documents

title: When an industrialist’s saree giveaway at Palani ended in stampede on Gandhi Jayanthi
content: Late at night in 1993 chaos broke out with everyone in the crowd wanting to grab the sarees. In the melee many elderly women fell down leading to a stampede that killed 12 women

title: Punjab seeks special package for flood damages; Centre says it stands shoulder to shoulder with people of Punjab
content: The relief of ₹1,600 crore announced by the Centre is miniscule in the wake of the grave loss suffered by Punjab, says CM Mann

title: Commission for quacks: How private hospitals in Telangana profit from unqualified practitioners
content: The practice of unqualified medical practitioners operating so-called ‘first aid centres’ has been rampant in Telangana for decades.

title: ED searches Reliance Infrastructure premises on charges of FEMA violation
content: In a statement Reliance Infrastructure clarified that the survey was relating to a matter dating back 15 years.

title: RSS should continue to focus on nation-building for next 100 years, says former Congress MP Karan Singh
content: Though Mr. Singh’s stance is at odds with the Congress’s official position on the RSS, the party has not issued any statement or clarification

title: Over 60 lakh hectares of farms hit by rains, have sought relief from Centre, says CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM seeks relief package for flood-affected farmland, rejects “wet drought” term, promises aid before Deepavali

title: Karur stampede: What triggered the chaos
content: The stampede at an overcrowded roadshow held by Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam founder and actor Vijay occurred due to poor planning and leadership

title: Uttarakhand police forms SIT to probe journalist Rajiv Pratap’s death
content: The journalist's family has alleged that he had been receiving threats following some of his news reports; journalists' organisations have also demanded a thorough probe into the circumstances of his death.

title: Wangchuk served NSA detention order: Ladakh administration
content: It accused the climate activist of suggesting “self-immolation” to people of Ladakh on “multiple occasions” on “lines of protests in Tibet”

title: Telangana logged 10,580 suicides in 2023, says NCRB
content: Family problems were cited as the predominant trigger for suicides in Telangana, claiming 4,680 lives, or 44.2% of the State’s total cases

title: Civil society groups, activists demand Wangchuk’s release
content: Addressing a press conference, Gitanjali Angmo, Mr. Wangchuk’s wife, said she had not been able to contact her husband, nor had the police provided her a copy of the NSA order yet.

title: Tamil Nadu seeks review of Supreme Court judgment directing teachers to qualify for TET or quit service
content: If the directions are implemented, the entire school system faces the imminent prospect of collapse, with mass disqualification of teachers and denial of classroom instruction to millions of children. This creates a direct conflict with Article 21A of the Constitution, which guarantees the fundamental right to education, Tamil Nadu argues in Supreme Court

title: Lorry topples on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ambur
content: Police said the lorry was proceeding towards Koyambedu Wholesale market in Chennai from Bengaluru to deliver a consignment of onions when the driver suddenly lost control of the vehicle.

title: Maharashtra, Karnataka report most number of farmer suicides
content: Removing import restrictions, succumbing to ‘tariff terrorism’ will worsen the situation, warns Kisan Sabha

title: Bihar had just five Passport and Foreigners Act cases in 2023: NCRB report
content: Illegal migration and infiltration have been raised as key issues ahead of the Bihar polls; according to NCRB data, in 2023, most of the cases pertaining to laws governing foreigners were registered in Bengal, followed by Tripura, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and Punjab

title: Yamamoto-led Dodgers oust Reds to reach NLDS
content: Yoshinobu Yamamoto struck out nine while pitching into the seventh inning, and the Los Angeles Dodgers broke it open with a four-run sixth inning to beat the Cincinnati Reds 8-4 on Wednesday night and advance to the National League Division Series.

title: Chisholm turns page, saves Yanks to force Game 3
content: One day after he was benched, Jazz Chisholm turned in a season-saving performance for the Yankees, making a run-saving play with his glove and scoring the tiebreaking run in Wednesday's do-or-die Game 2 against the Red Sox.

title: Machado makes Cubs pay for Imanaga 'mistake'
content: Cubs manager Craig Counsell defended his decision to leave lefty Shota Imanaga in the game to face Padres slugger Manny Machado, who hit a two-run home run.

title: Source: Collier tore ankle ligaments on collision
content: Lynx star Napheesa Collier suffered a Grade 2 tear of three ligaments in her ankle and a muscle in her shin during the collision with Mercury forward Alyssa Thomas, a source told ESPN.

title: Colts' Howard abruptly retires, says 'family first'
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Nashville lifts 1st major trophy with Open Cup win
content: Nashville SC beat Austin FC 2-1 in final of the U.S. Open Cup on Wednesday night at Q2 Stadium to win the team's first-ever major trophy.

title: Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B private capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: A.J. Brown says post wasn't about Eagles, Hurts
content: Eagles receiver A.J. Brown took responsibility Wednesday for letting his "frustrations boil over" Sunday and stated that his post on social media wasn't directed at anyone inside the building, including quarterback Jalen Hurts.

title: 📉 College football Bottom 10: Penn State's woe
content: Under the brightest lights, the Nittany Lions came up short again, earning them a spot on our dubious list.

title: Pereira was on the wrong side of UFC title history once; will that happen again?
content: pereira will have two obstacles to overcome in his attempt to regain the UFC light heavyweight championship . his primary focus will be on champion Magomed Ankalaev . he will be the first bout for both fighters since the belt changed hands . pereira was a participant in one of those four triumphant rematches .

title: Projecting the NHL's leap-forward players for 2025-26, led by Matty Beniers
content: a "breakout" does not always mean offensive production . many of the players on this list are expected to see major role increases . a few of them should break out in the traditional sense . it feels like this is finally Bedard's year .

title: Women's Bracketology: UConn projects as top overall seed with one month to season
content: a month before the 2025-26 season opens, there's a fresh look at what may look like . if we last forecasted the bracket in April, the UConn Huskies had just been crowned champions . it's the big news as we enter the final months before the season .

title: Many top options at PG, C in points league draft tiers
content: the first round featured zero small forwards, one power forward and one shooting guard with four centers and four point guards . in that same draft, the fourth and eighth rounds were dominated by shooting guards and big men . this gives a quick snapshot of the trend we've been seeing in recent seasons .

title: What went wrong, what needs to happen next for U.S.

title: Which hitters are MVPs, LVPs of 2025?
content: four players hit 50 or more home runs this past season . DH/SP Shohei Ohtani and New York Yankees OF Aaron Judge were top picks in most every fantasy draft . it is hard to quantify the value for a player when a manager adds him to their roster .

title: Ranking every Women's Champions League kit in league phase
content: the UEFA women's champions league phase is scheduled to begin on Oct. 7 . it's time we assess the 2025-26 home, away, and third kits they'll be wearing while competing . we've got plain kits and patterned kits, kits inspired by landmarks and ancient civilizations . almost 50 out-and-out, retro third-kit designs in the mix this season .

title: Tracking MLB offseason manager changes: Snitker won't return -- who could Braves target?
content: the first managerial changes of the 2025-26 offseason came on the first day after the season . the San Francisco Giants dismissed Bob Melvin, the Minnesota Twins fired Rocco Baldelli, and the Texas Rangers announced that Bruce Bochy will not return . ESPN will track all of the managerial hirings and firings .

title: 'No, we don't': Ex-Panthers Mayfield, Darnold won't reminisce on Carolina days
content: the Tampa Bay Buccaneers quarterback threw some shade at the Carolina Panthers . he was asked if he and now-seahawks quarterback Sam Darnold "reminisce about the good old days in Carolina" in 2022, the Panthers traded a conditional fifth-round pick with the Cleveland Browns for Mayfield .

title: PSG show Lamine Yamal, Barcelona what it takes to become UCL winners
